definitions.text: kill as a means of socially sanctioned punishment
examples: In some states, criminals are executed
The Mafioso who collaborated with the police was executed
execute the decision of the people
execute a will or a deed

definitions.text: carry out a process or program, as on a computer or a machine
examples: run a new program on the Mac

definitions.text: carry out or perform an action
examples: John did the painting, the weeding, and he cleaned out the gutters
the skater executed a triple pirouette

definitions.text: sign in the presence of witnesses
